Reviews.Title: “Clean but bad bed and noisy”
Reviews.Author: Irvansaid
Reviews.Content: I don't understand why so many reviewers here said that the bed was very comfortable, it was as hard as a wooden block. Yes it was super king and spacious, but it was far from being comfortable. Mattresses these days are very comfortable, people who said the mattress on Suite 33 is comfortable certainly have never slept on "comfortable" mattresses. Other than that the "suite" was actually a very nice room, spacious, very clean and very well lit. However, the bathroom, though very large, needed more lights, it was rather dark. Amenities was minimal, but we expected that considering the rate was not very expensive. There was a little kitchen area with microwave, stove and even dish washer, but no utensils whatsoever. I guess originally, they were designing the suites for long stay guests. The street was noisy, a lot of noisy drunk people at night, there were a few striptease joints on the street and it can get a little 'Bronxy'. I didn't mind though, because again, it was cheap. it was close to a lot of things but I could feel that it was not on the safest street in Madrid. If I have a teenage kid, I wouldn't let him or her roaming around the area alone. All in all it was a very good value for money, pity the bed was very hard and uncomfortable. The room was very clean though, and the staff was quite helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: IIM612
Reviews.Content: Hotel has excellent location. Walking distance from main sightseeing places. Rooms are big and comfortable and price was good.

Reviews.Title: “excellent position and staff”
Reviews.Author: qstnmk
Reviews.Content: This suite hotel is conveniently located close to metro and Gran Via, and you can walk anywhere in the city center without catching metro or bus. Walking to Prado takes about 20 minutes, 5 min to Royal Palace and 10 min to Puerta del Sol. The nearbies offer many restaurants (some excellent) and, since the Police station is just next door, is very quiet. Rooms are big and modern and have a kitchenette (which, surprinsingly, is not equipped, so you can't even have a cup of tea....). I was at the 4th floor, looking calle de Leganitos: wearing earplugs is usually enaugh to stop noise from the outside. Unfortunately my room was close to the elevators, so I could hear the engine working (earplugs are of great help). Rooms are clean, but cleaning is made at around 5 pm, when tourists come back from a long day out, longing for a shower, and, since this is a suite hotel, the are no common spaces to wait in. Staff is very kind and extremely helpful. I strongly raccomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A ways out but good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Marybeth S
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for during a two-day trip to Madrid. Booked two rooms as there were three of us. Rooms were very large with a full kitchen (though no cutlery/dishes/etc.) Probably a perfect hotel for families with children. Room was clean as was the bathroom, though getting in and out of the shower was a challenge due to the layout; would recommend they get sliding shower doors! Hotel is a ways out, but conveniently located near the Metro so it was easy to get to after taking the train to Madrid from Valencia. Staff was nice; Alberto at the front desk was very engaging and had a lot of information to impart to us. Couldn't change from heat to AC as this was controlled by the hotel and they only have one or the other operating at one time. Though we did not have breakfast included in our stay, one must walk up the hill to another hotel for the included breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice!”
Reviews.Author: lumamahdi
Reviews.Content: We arrived early from Philadelphia and the hotel offered us to stay in another room till the time of our check in and it was for free! Very polite and helpful staff and the rooms are clean and you have a mini kitchen although no dishes or any accessories are there. We stayed in room 47 and it was very good for a family of four. Location is great as you are a walking distance from most of the attractions. Nearby restaurants has Arabic & Chinese cuisine but with five minutes walk you see a great variety of choices. The suites business centre is located in their sister hotel Colonso which is about 20 meters away.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: Travelerdiva
Reviews.Content: Wonderfully convenient, just steps away from the Plaza de Espana metro on a small street. We stayed in this hotel for two non-consecutive nights and it was wonderful. Very friendly and helpful staff, and beautiful rooms (we stayed in 54 and 47). This was vacation, so we didn't want to spend a lot, but the rooms were at least as nice as places I stay on business that cost 3-4 times as much per night! Fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, rooms and service.”
Reviews.Author: Mike106635
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a hotel within easy walking distance of the tourist centre of Madrid, the Suites33 is ideal - within ten minutes walk of the Palacio Real, and twenty minutes walk from El Prado. If you don't like walking, the hotel is close to both metro and bus routes, but we found that the taxis in Madrid were surprisingly cheap - five euros from the hotel to El Prado, for example. Taxis from the airport to Suites33 came to about 40 euros each way. The bedrooms and bathrooms are spacious and clean, and the kitchen well equipped except, bizarrely, for a complete lack of crockery, cutlery, pots and kettles! The staff are extremely helpful and will provide you with a tourist map of Madrid and directions. A hotel 50 metres up the road provides a good buffet breakfast for 7 euros, and there are any number of good, reasonably priced restaurants nearby. Other reviewers have mentioned that the area near the hotel isn't the smartest, but Plaza de Espana and Gran Via are two minutes away, and there is a local police station almost next to the hotel. The area didn't bother us in the slightest and we had no problems. There was some noise from the street during the night - sirens, horns, revellers etc. - but so close to the centre of Madrid it must be nearly impossible to find somewhere entirely peaceful. The Suites33 is definitely excellent value for money, and is where I will stay during future visits.

Reviews.Title: “strange set up”
Reviews.Author: megsni
Reviews.Content: This was a nice enough place. A little difficult to find but a waiter took us through his restaurant and out the other side to point us in the right direction. The room/suite is all set up with a kitchen...sink, oven, microwave. Great! But there are NO utensils!!! No pots, pans, crockery, cutlery. Found it very strange, and got the strangest look from receptionist when we asked for a cup! But very close to the metro stop so handy to anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and great service”
Reviews.Author: Annarejser
Reviews.Content: This hotel was really great for the 5 nights we stayed during our holiday in December. The room, bathroom and kitchen were big, clean and even had a little balcony towards the street + the wifi worked perfectly. As it has been said in some of the other reviews there was some street noise at night, however, it did not bother us. The location is great, just near the metro station Plaza Espagna - and it’s really easy, cheap and fast to get there with the metro from the airport. The members of the staff were extremely helpful and gave us good tips about the city. Btw. just a tip about the city: When you cannot take in more of the great art i Madrid then go to the zoo. It's the best zoo I've visited in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, quiet, central and good value for money”
Reviews.Author: siobhanmuskett
Reviews.Content: We can highly recommend Suites 33 We stayed on 30th November as we were going to a performance of the Cirque du Soleil,(which was fantastic). The room/suite was very spacious with simple but smart decor, clean and tidy. Everything you might expect was provided. It was quiet despite being in a busy area. Very convenient for travelling to the airport or visiting key sites in Madrid. The price of 80 Euros for a suite in the centre of Madrid was excellent value for money. The people on reception were very welcoming and helpful. They provided information on transport and where to go. There was a very good cafe almost next door, recommended by the hotel staff which was perfect for breakfast or meals. There was a kitchen but no equipment, apparently it is not used normally. It would be more convenient if you could use the kitchen for a cup of tea at least.

Reviews.Title: “Great place great location”
Reviews.Author: Britmad
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a couple of nights and really enjoyed our stay there. The rooms were very spacious and clean the beds were reasonably comfortable and would definitely recommend this hotel. It's very close to the metro station and is great for the nearby shops and restaurants all within walking distance. The staff were very friendly and helpful the only downside was it was in quite a noisy location but that was mostly sirens and people outside not anything to do with the hotel. Was a great place to stay for a couple of nights

Reviews.Title: “Excelent location, modern, value, friendly great!”
Reviews.Author: Catameza
Reviews.Content: Located near Gran Via, modern equiped! Good simple service, no frills but neat and friendly service

Reviews.Title: “Central, clean and affordable”
Reviews.Author: Beanbag79
Reviews.Content: I was really pleasantly surprised with Suites 33. I booked the hotel from Late Rooms for a really reasonable price and apart from it being central, I didn't really expect much. It was easy to find, it's about half an hour away from the airport and one change on the Metro which costs two Euro fifty. There is also a station one minute away from the hotel ((((Plaza De Espana??))) from memory. The hotel lobby is a bit no frills, but the room itself was modern, spacious and bright. It also had a little kitchen which is a nice extra and a hairdryer which was reasonable. The staff were helpful, especially Daniel on reception who recommended bars and restaurants and handed out free maps. This was a great base to explore Madrid and great for the price. Do be very careful on the Metro however when travelling to Madrid. It can be very busy and my friend got pickpocketed by what we think was a nasty little woman. Also, there are different stations for opposite directions of travel although these are called the same. It is quite confusing as only one station is marked on maps. If you go through the barriers by accident at the wrong side, a really grumpy guard will expect you to grovel about how sorry you are and possibly not let you through at all.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice --- but bring earplugs”
Reviews.Author: Charleston_WVMike
Reviews.Content: We had two "family rooms", each of which had a king-size bed and a foldout sofa. Rooms were large, and had a cooktop, small refrigerator, and microwave (although there were no utensils, plates, glasses, or cookware). There was a metro stop at each end of the block (for two different metro lines), so getting around was easy. The front desk personnel were very helpful. Numerous restaurants within a block or two. The only complaint was noise levels in one of the rooms. One of the people in that room said the noise came through the walls as if they were made of a single sheet of drywall. A couple of people in that room said that they hardly got any sleep at all. Unfortunate, because Suites 33 was very good otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet and convenient”
Reviews.Author: Marc_and_Tracy
Reviews.Content: We found Suites 33 on the TripAdvisor site. It was an easy walk from one of two Metro stations, Santo Domingo or Plaza de Espana. We had no problem taking the Metro from the airport. We purchased the 2 day pass and proceeded to get our money's worth the first 6 hours of our visit! The front desk staff were very helpful. We ended up having breakfast at the Hotel Colosso which is the sister hotel up the street. The room is SUPER clean ( a big deal for me). The bed was extemely comfortable and the bathroom very large with bidet, tub and shower combo and plenty of hot water. We had a room at the back which was very quiet. I agree with other reviewers that the area looks sketchy, but we never had any problems. The food in the area is expensive being so close to the Gran Via, but we were able to walk or ride anywhere with ease and chose other locations for eating.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty nice hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: JDaws1106
Reviews.Content: Pros: helpful front desk--helped us with dinner reservations, decent sized room, pretty clean, very close to the metro Cons: the street looks a little sketchy and since our room faced the street we heard people partying at all hours of the night. when we left at 8am on our last day there were literally people still partying in the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: BrazTravellers
Reviews.Content: We stood there for 6 nights in september 2011. Our room was very spacious, clean, modern, comfy, quiet, and located on the first floor (there is a lift, so don't worry if you stay on a higher floor). The staff was just great: everyone was extremely helpful and had always a sincere smile. Everything we asked was done (we had a little problem with the the bathroom, wich was solved in short time). The location is great: less than 3 blocks to the Gran Via and the same to the metro station (Plaza de España) and a few blocks more to the Royal Palace. If you like shopping, go up some blocks through Gran Via and you'll get to El Corte Inglés (Macy's from Spain) and FNAC just across. There are lots of restaurants, gift shops, "bares de tapas", theaters and cinemas very close. The hotel doesn't offer breakfast, but you have a kitchen in the room with microwave and fridge, so you can just buy some things (around) and make your own breakfast, or have it in one of the many places at the Gran Via. There were 2 little problems: the ar condicioner wasn't perfect (silent, but not cooling as much as we wanted) and there was a slight cigarette smell at the bathroom, maybe coming from the ventilation system (we believe some guests smoke in the rooms). But still, the hotel deserves a high evaluation. We definetly would go back to the Suites 33.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Happy_Traveler_NC
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Suites 33 for one night on our way to the Canary Islands. I wish we had planned to stay longer! The staff was delightful and willing to help with any request. They even came to our room to help us with the TV remote!! The wake up calls were right on time and made by a person, not a machine! We asked for a taxi to take us to the airport at 9 AM and it was right there!! The room we had was number 21. No view, but exceptionally clean. Great linens and a nice bed. Also we had a small kitchenette. They are within easy walking distance to the Royal Palace, Plaza de Espana, the Metro and the Gran Via. Also, the tour company that we used for a city tour was right around the corner. VERY CONVENIENT!! I would recommend this hotel for anyone who wants a good value and a location where they can really explore Madrid for 3-4 days.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very spacious apartment”
Reviews.Author: Rob T
Reviews.Content: We only had one night in Madrid and Suites 33 was a great location . Our 5th floor apartment was very modern and spacious ( we had requested a quiet room when we booked on line and that's what we got) - easy to access the floor due to lift. Reception staff very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “great choice”
Reviews.Author: zaidsaad
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 6 days in july, the staff are friendly, and helpful. the room was big,quite and comfortable, with a frig.and a microwave.The location is great,close to metro and shops.but best of all the price was great.we will definatly go back.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely brilliant location,great hotel,great hotel staff”
Reviews.Author: eveningstar10
Reviews.Content: i have just got back from madrid,i stayed at suites 33 following the great reviews on trip advisor and every single one of them was true!!!i couldnt ve chosen a better hotel.location is perfect,i walked everywhere didnt need to take the metro cause is so central.the rooms are very big,for spain standards,and very modern,incredibly clean and has all amenities that you need in the bathroom.it even has a little kitchen facility,you just need to ask for crockery at reception. the reception staff were very friendly and helful,in fact they went out of their way to help me.make sure to ask for an interior room if you want a good night sleep(they are super quiet),they first gave me 1 on the 1st floor interior and was very noisy,not the hotels fault,unfortuneatly the people staying on the room right above mine were very very very loud and were moving the furniture at 4am!!!odd,anyway so the hotel staff were very apologetic and moved me to an interior room on the 3rd floor(non smoking floor) and was so quiet i had the best sleep i had in ages!! i cant wait to come back to madrid and come back to suites 33!!

Reviews.Title: “excellent - can't think of anything bad to say about this city-hotel”
Reviews.Author: moelle
Reviews.Content: Right in the middle of Madrid. Great staff. Very polite, smiling and helpful. The room was cleaned thoroughly every day, and even though we were staying at a floor where smoking was allowed, the room didn't smell.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious and perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: bonadette
Reviews.Content: Location is perfect - 100m from plaza de espana metro station and right in the middle of the city. Rooms are massive for Europe - my husband and I had a double room on level 4. Very quiet and aircon was perfect temp. Kitchen avail with microwave and fridge - only downside is no cutlery, plates, pots, etc provided. But with so many supermarkets around and everything so cheap - we did a small food shop for only 18 euros including wine, it doesn't matter. Bathroom large with shower and bath, great pressure and temp. Daily maid service too. Free wifi very fast, block out curtains, tv, firm bed, minibar. A great first hotel for our European holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: KilicK
Reviews.Content: I love this place. It's right next to Gran Via which is the busiest street in Madrid. About 3-5 minutes of walk to at least 2 metro. Plenty of restaurant around the hotel. Service is great, the lady in front did everything we ask for and more: she helped us finding ticket for the bull fighting, she printed out the ticket for us and gave us all the infos needed. They speak english very well. Room is very clean, has a safe and a fridge. Nothing bad to say... if I return to Madrid to visit, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: yshell
Reviews.Content: Plaza de España metro stop is a couple of minutes away, making the subway station very accessible especially when you have to travel very early in the morning to catch the train from Madrid to any other cities. My mom and I were very apprehensive at first because it doesn't look to be a very nice neighborhood but after a day or two of walking from there to Puerta del Sol, it was ok. There are a couple of grocery stores nearby aside from Supermercado which is found right at the building of Suites 33. You can stock up there with noodles or crackers and other stuff if you don't feel like buying from cafeterias or restaurants for food. Our room has a fridge, electric stove and microwave. Speaking of room, ours was clean and smells good for a floor that's ok with smoking in it. The bathroom is nice, large and well lit. Suites 33 suited our needs and we're very satisfied as the hotel staff were very courteous and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel & location. Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: RustyCatLeeds
Reviews.Content: Suites 33 is right in the centre of Madrid, only a 5 minute walk away from Sol & Plaza Mayor and right next to Plaza Espana. Its a really nice, modern hotel. Our room even had kitchen facilities including a microwave. We had a lovely large room, the bathroom was a bit small but i wouldn't let that put you off Madrid is a really cool city & if i ever return i will book Suites 33 without hesitation

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel. Amazing location!”
Reviews.Author: Liubov777
Reviews.Content: Rooms are big and nice, location is amazing, you can walk to the most of the points, staff is very helpful,free wifi, right by metro. But its getting a little noisy on weekends because its a center of the city, so make sure to take earplugs with you ;) I would stay here again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: rbc_8
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel in the heart of madrid, 10 minutes walk to Plaza Mayor and old city, 1 minute from Gran Via, cafes, shops etc. The hotel is simple but extremely clean, the front desk staff is very helpful, our room (a triple) was very large and comfortable, with no view whatsoever (the windows looked into a miniscule courtyard) but exteremely quite. We loved the hotel, loved its location and loved Madrid. Great value and hightly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: PabloMUFC
Reviews.Content: Great location with great service. Ask for a silent room and you´ll spend a perfect night.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Spot”
Reviews.Author: jimqif
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 8 nights this month (June). The staff was great - friendly, patient and helpful. The location of the hotel is within very easy reach of the Royal Palace and the Opera, as well as lots of nice cafes and cervecerias. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great price”
Reviews.Author: Carline
Reviews.Content: Suites 33 was much cheaper than most other places in Madrid, so I was a little dubious - but I needn't have been. The rooms are very large and comfortable. They accommodated my request for a quiet room. A previous reviewer said they didn't have utensils - but the reception staff told me we just had to ask. Breakfast isn't included, but there are loads of places to breakfast out with the locals - but mich more fun that going to their sister hotel up the road. Location - its just near Plaza de Espana and Santa Domingo metro stations, but we walked mainly. It was just 5 mins to the palace and another 5 to the plaza mayor. The area around Plaza Domingo is surprisingly vibrant and there are loads of bars and restaurants around there.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dean138
Reviews.Content: Staff are excellent, good size room, clean and good location. Don't bother with the breakfast they suggest at the hotel coloso up the street. Not worth the 10 euro.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Madrid - Clean, Modern, Friendly, and Good Location”
Reviews.Author: muzzy1855
Reviews.Content: Suites 33 in Madrid surpassed my expectations. As someone who has not traveled extensively through Europe, I heard that hotel rooms are often smaller, dirtier, and less modern than hotel rooms in the United States. Suites 33 was a pleasant surprise as it contradicted those notions completely! The room was spacious, with two double beds pushed together to form a single large bed. Our unit had a kitchen, complete with an empty refrigerator, stove top, microwave, sink, and plenty of cupboards. The only small part of the room was the bathroom, which was a bit cramped, but serviceable and clean nonetheless. While not 5-star modern, the room was fairly up-to-date. It sported a small flat-screen TV (with channels in English, French, Spanish, and German), marble floors, an updated bathroom, and a small balcony. Also nice was an easy-to-use personal safe; great for stashing away our cash Euros. (Madrid is known for pickpockets, so this was a great way to minimize our cash on-hand each day). The staff at the hotel were very friendly, and always greeted us when we entered or left. Most spoke great English. Housekeeping did a nice job each day tidying up the room daily. Lastly, the location is fairly convenient. It's on a small street near the Plaza de Espana and Calle Gran Via. It's a short walk to many centers including the Plaza Mayor, Puerto del Sol, La Latina, and other areas. The street has a few grocery stores on it, and an excellent Middle Eastern hookah and tea restaurant. Only two downsides. One is that the street itself can be a bit noisy late on Friday and Saturday night, but that's likely true anywhere since Madrid parties late. Two, the free WiFi internet at the hotel is spotty at best. Don't plan on going online much, if at all here. Bring a smartphone! Considering we got the room for about $120 (US) a night, no complaints here. If I'm ever back in Madrid, this is where I'm going!

Reviews.Title: “Very good large rooms”
Reviews.Author: Biajante
Reviews.Content: Most Positive: - Very spacious and modern rooms, better than many 4 stars rooms - Kitchenet in rooms Most Negative: - Hard bed for my taste - No kitchen utilities - Noisy by the morning with waitresses pushing beds and tables

Reviews.Title: “Good rooms, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: alanfromvictoria
Reviews.Content: Excellent little hotel very close to all sorts of stuff and around the corner from the main drag Grand Via and not even half-a-block from the Grand Via metro station. You'll walk 50x more getting to the metro in the airport than up the block to the hotel. Pay attention, though, it's a small door and small reception area. But the staff were very friendly and helpful. The street in front isn't much for looks but it's decent and safe and you're so close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, super clean, just beat the morning rush”
Reviews.Author: OzzyMuz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Suites 33 on a recent trip to Madrid. The hotel is located in a pretty central area, and easy walk to some great tapas bars, and a 15-20min walk to the Prado. The room had a big bedroom and kitchenette area.The rooms were extremely clean and well presented. The bathroom was smallish but ok. The bed were very firm. The only issue was the water pipes stared to "whine" at 7:30am when the first person had thier shower. This continued with the ensuing morning shower rush, dashing any hope for a bit of a sleep in on our holiday. Our room was at the back with no street noise.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: dnish46
Reviews.Content: After reviewing lots of hotels in Madrid, I decided to book 6 nights at Suites 33. It was a great location, with easy walking to Plaza Mayor and there is a Metro stop just 3 minutes from the hotel. The room was plenty big for two people. It is not ultra elegant, but we weren't expecting it to be. We just wanted a place to clean and comfortable place to sleep after long days of walking and sightseeting. While we didn't really need any help from the front desk they were always very friendly. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: travel_me848
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for our honeymoon. Had trouble locating it at first as its not on the main gran via street. Short search on the internet (thanks to starbuck's wifi) lead us to the right path. However as there is no signboard we nearly missed it and walked pass if not for a chance glance. Room was good enough size with basic amneties but the toilet was quite small. There's even a kitchen in the room but we didnt use it tho. Area is quite but safe. Police station is few lots away. Staff was excellent and helpful especially the guy who work in the day shift. Excellent location. MRT is walking distance which will connect you to other part of the city incl. airport itself. Plenty of shops incl. MNG, ZARA, H&M to name a few within walking distance. Food can also easily be obtained as plenty of restaurant nearby. Wifi is also available which is a plus point for traveler. Would definitely stay here again for the rate given and no hesitation to recommend it to others as well.

Reviews.Title: “A Great hotel with perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Michal_nadav
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the Suites 33 for 4 nights at the end of March and were very happy with our choice. The location of the hotel is perfect right next to the Plaza de Espana and the Grand Via. Plaza de Sol is in 5 min walking. Our pleasant stay started when Justine welcomed us with a big smile after a long flight and explained to us all we need to know for getting started to know this amazing city. The room was very big and cozy and very very clean. The room includes a kitchen with microwave and refrigerator, but with no plates/silverwave. We LOVED Madrid and Loved this hotels and his kind and welcoming staff and we will defenitley come back to Suites 33.

Reviews.Title: “What A Great Find !!!”
Reviews.Author: nickgatt
Reviews.Content: This little hotel has an amazing location. It's 20 seconds walk to Grand Via and 30 seconds walk to Plaza De Espana and the Plaza De Espana Metro station. The rooms are a decent size and are very clean and the bathroom was immaculate. I didn't really need reception to sort anything out for me but they were always friendly whenever I spoke to them and the free Wi-Fi was pretty decent. For the money, I seriously doubt you will find a better place to stay in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with central location in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: WorcesterLinda
Reviews.Content: Suites 33 is very centrally located only 2 minutes walk from the Plaza Espana. Despite the central location, it is in a quiet side street. We asked for and got a quiet room at the back of the hotel and we experienced no noise even on weekend nights when Madrid is at its busiest. The room was spacious, with a sleeping area, a kitchen area, a well fitted modern bathroom and an entrance hallway. The kitchen had a microwave, a fridge and a two ring electric cooker hob. However, there were no utensils provided. If you bring your own plastic cups, spoons and knives, and tea/coffee you will be OK. There are several mini-markets nearby where you can buy basics, including one next door to the hotel. The hotel seems to be in the Chinatown area so most shops are good for Chinese food, but a bit limited on more western things. A better mini-market is located just up the road toward Plaza Santo Domingo (out of hotel and turn right) about 3 minutes walk away, and for the best supermarket selection go another 3 minutes walk from Santo Domingo to Callao metro station where there is a very large department store – El Corte Ingles – which has a vast supermarket in its basement, with good value food and drink. There are numerous restaurants nearby. We enjoyed the Cafeteria Domingo, which is on Plaza Santa Domingo and had their “menu del dia”, which was excellent for 10 euro (or 11.50 euro at weekends). Three courses plus bread and wine or water, with about 6 choices for each course. The place was usually very busy with locals, which is always a good sign. They seem only to deal in full bottles of wine so if there are two of you ask for one wine and one water – this will result in a full bottle of wine with an additional bottle of water. The local tourist sites such as the Royal Palace, Plaza Major, Puerta del Sol, Cathedral etc are all within easy walking distance and it is a short metro ride to the Prado area – or walkable if you have 20 minutes to spare. Have a look at the Templo de Debod which is located just on the far side of the Plaza Espana. This is an Egyptian temple given to Spain in thanks for its help in the raising of the Abu Simbel temple in Egypt, transported and re-erected in Madrid in a pleasant park setting. Well worth a visit and not on the main tourist route. The three staff we encountered on reception all spoke good English and were very helpful and friendly. The check-in was very efficient and we were made to feel very welcome – not always the case on arrival!. Especially good was the lady, who it turns out is Polish (from Krakow) and has lived in Spain for 15 years. We would recommend the Suites 33 hotel as a good central base from which to explore Madrid and would return there on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Suites 33 The Madrid secret”
Reviews.Author: Di2006
Reviews.Content: Very nice Hotel,very clean and excellent staff Madrid very easy to get around Underground / buses or walk if you feel energetic - we did and found lots of wonderful little gem restaurants and shops Madrid is a wonderful place for a couple to explore over a long weekend

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Dyowsa
Reviews.Content: 1. we chose this hotel over the others in consideration because they said they have wifi. we don't have wifi in our room, and can only access wifi while in the lobby, which has a single seat that looks like its merely for decorative purposes and uncomfortable to hang around in, just to get connection. we asked the front desk to do something about this, bugging them the entire time and the night/afternoon shift guy says: no one else is complaining. 2. in a few hours that we check in and no internet connection we tell them that we demand a better room, either in the same building or at the Hotel Coloso (also theirs), and the reception told us that we can't anymore, because the room is already paid. 3. we check out the next morning and the reception now tells us we're not yet paid. I told her about what transpired, and all that she can say is 'Sorry'. 4. the room was very stuffy that time, no wifi and we were lied to. thats all.

Reviews.Title: “Central, clean and friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: DuckieUk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Suites 33 for 2 nights for a weekend trip to Madrid. It is centrally located (1 min walk from metro). We had a room not facing the road, on level 4 (note that this is a smoking floor though), and there was no issue with noise at all. There wasn't a strong smoke smell though. The front desk staff were extremely friendly and helpful, especially Justyna. There is no breakfast provided by this hotel, but there are many nearby cafes. The room was very clean, large, and had all necessary ameneties. Overall, a great value for money place to stay, highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Svetlanagolubeva
Reviews.Content: I spent there 8 nights from december 11. I have been given a real roof flat, an enormous room with living room and a large bathroom. Very quiet room, clean and comfortable for a good price. Wi fi internet is included in the price. I would recommend this hotel and I will go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and still quiet”
Reviews.Author: Maikench
Reviews.Content: We had a very quiet room, nicely decorated and with a kitchen. Only odd thing was a kitchen without any equipment. Who is travelling with cooking equipment, plates, forkes, knives etc.?! Service was top - very kind and helpful. The hotel is really in the best location, right in the middle of Madrid and in walking distance to most attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Value, great service, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: JDHelm
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got back from a 2 week trip to Spain and Italy and this is where we kicked it off. We could not have been more pleased with our overall experience. The hotel staff was very helpful and checked us in early. They helped us navigate around the city and highlight an ideal blend of sightseeing and relaxing. To find a negative we'd have to get pretty nickpicky, but I guess the beds are a little firm for our taste, but thats just our preference. We wouldn't stay anywhere else should we be fortunate enough to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vale for Money”
Reviews.Author: DonAlejandro72
Reviews.Content: Repeatedly stayed at this hotel and always come back. Excellent location: Gran Via / Plaza de España metro within 2 minute walk, Puerta del Sol within 10 minute walk, many restaurants nearby. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Our rooms has always been modern, very spacious and clean. All in all, definately recommendable, great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: asbarreto
Reviews.Content: It is a very good value for the money. Rooms are very comfortable and spacious. There is no restaurant, so they don't offer breakfast. However, there is a nearby hotel where you can have breakfatst paying 10 euros/person. Location is great, really near from metro and several tourist attractions. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Free internet is also available.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location, good value.”
Reviews.Author: vmmh
Reviews.Content: It's a clean hotel with spacious rooms and kitchenettes. No plates or utensils of any kind though, but the fridge and microwave can come in useful for snacks. Very good location, two blocks from the Plaza Espana metro and walking distance to several major sites.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: vmsPhiladelphia
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Suites 33 18Sep10-24Sep10. Very convenient location near Plasa España. About 2 minutes walk to the metro and 10 to the palace, monastery, Diebold and park. Approximately 30-45 mins (depending on how fast you walk) to the museums and Atocha (the main train station). Close to the Sunday rostra. Lots of shopping, restaurants and entertainment. The hotel itself is in the middle of the block on the right side of the street if you are walking up the hill. We arrived at 10:15 am on the 18th after traveling for about 12 hours and were told that the hotel's policy is no check-in before 2:00 pm so we could leave our bags but we could not gain access to our room. There really isn't a lobby so we couldn't even loiter if we wanted to. That was a little disappointing, but a policy is a policy. The woman at the front desk was very nice but did not speak any English, so I had the chance to shake the rust off my Spanish. There were two male front desk attendants that spoke English, one fairly well and the other comme ci comme ça. All were very friendly and cordial. The hotel is a few buildings down from the police station which was busy day and night. Muggings, assaults, drunken disorderly issues, prostitutes, drug problems etc. For those who don't know, Madrid is a major city and has all of the crime problems of every other major city around the world. It just so happens that if you stay in Suites 33, you are reminded of the problems every time you leave the hotel and head up hill. There is also a semi-seedy club a few doors up from the police station. The suite itself was a very nice and despite the busy area, very quiet. The suites has a full kitchen, full bathroom (shower and tub) and a king size bed. To note, power in the room requires your room key to be inserted into a slot near the door. This means when you leave the room, power to the refrigerator, heating/cooling and all other appliances is turned off when you remove your room key. Don't plan to store perishables in the refrigerator (or ask for an extra room key). There is an elevator if you don't like to walk stairs. The hotel does not have the following: Restaurant or room service. If you want food you are invited to go the their sister hotel a few doors up the street; a business/center for internet access to check e-mail, get directions or to do a web check-in at the airport; no alarm clock (in case you can't use the alarm on your mobile) and no shampoo or conditioner toiletries...you get a tiny tube of shower gel/body wash and a little bar of soap. We enjoyed our stay in the hotel and recommend it to travelers without children.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay in Madrid for friends in 20's”
Reviews.Author: ystavitsky
Reviews.Content: Suites 33 was absolutely a great choice to stay in Madrid. My friend and I, both in our early 20's stayed here during our short 3 day stay. The hotel is near everything. No matter where we wanted to go, we were able to walk there in minutes, and if you decide to go further out of the city, the train is close too. The hotel itself is super clean, and our room was extremely large (even for american standards). We had 2 very plush, super comfortable queen size beds (which after a night out in Madrid nightlife we were unable to get out of until 1 pm :) ) We had a great bathroom, and even a kitchenette. Though we didn't cook there, we were able to keep large bottles of water and snacks in the fridge. Staff was really friendly, free wifi, and great restaurants really close by considering you're right in the middle of the city. It's right behind Gran Via, so you have the center with the peace and quiet, all at a great price. We paid about $150 a night. We 100% recommend this hotel for Madrid, so you can definitely stop searching for something else and stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and good size bedrooms, only noisy”
Reviews.Author: sjdw
Reviews.Content: Although the rooms are very clean and spacious, it is located in an outgoing area. So good quality and price, however you should not mind the noise till 6 in the morning during the weekends.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: misscherry17
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights with my partner for a weekend trip away. Hotel is in a great location, close to the Gran Via and close to the Metro. As per previous reviews, it is slightly hard to find as there is a huge sign out the front. Room was lovely and modern, bed was huge although the pillows were small and odd. The floors are tiled, so can get cold. As english speaking tourists, we were able to communicate with staff, and they were helpful with booking us a tour and giving directions where to find good churros! Location is great, walking distance to alot of tourist areas including Puerta Del Sol. Would definitely recommend this hotel to others!

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: ceto8
Reviews.Content: Just came back from 3 weeks holiday in Spain & Portugal. We stayed in this hotel for 5 days. Request for a quiet room. I would rank this hotel as number 1 among all the hotels we have stayed. The hotel signage is quite inconspicuous...It's just beside a small "supermercado", the signage of which is very obvious.The only drawback is the unavailability of kitchen utensils in the small kitchenette. So if you want to save from eating out bring microwaveable disposable plastic bowl which you can throw away after your trip. There are 2 fridge in the room. The countertop burner doesn't work, but it's ok since you are not cooking a lot when you are on holiday. It would have been better if there is a toaster. The free wireless internet is really a good deal. And if you want to print something, you can ask it at the reception. The staff are very helpful, accomodating, attentive to our needs, and friendly...especially Alberto. He was very apologetic when he gave us the wrong direction for the best paella in Madrid. Second time around, we found where the restaurant is & it's worth it... La Paella De La Reina. Must have a reservation or come early as there is a queue even late at night.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with great value, adequate for all needs in the city”
Reviews.Author: pinnovel
Reviews.Content: The area is central indeed, with Metro and buses at a few hundred meters. Many restaurants within a mile radius, with a lot of choice, especially with non-Spanish cuisines. Beware of the local Starbucks place! Incompetent and unfriendly. Room was very good except for the room's water heat, which was in plain sight and really a sore in the otherwise nice room. However, the fact that there was a boiler, together with a full kitchen, is certainly a plus for families or people with special needs with regards to food. Staff was nice and multilingual. Parking requires a bit of effort since you'll have to resort to a nearby hotel's valet service, but it's cheap compared to nearby parking garages. If you don't need sophisticated services from your hotel, but just need a clean place to sleep, possibly making your own food, with good position, Internet and some international TV, this is the place to go in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Central location, great rooms, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: emm3cee
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on my first visit to Madrid and highly recommend this hotel. I was very pleased with the central location, the friendly helpful staff, my massive room (complete with kitchenette) and the very reasonable price. It does lack visible signage so just look for the name above the door.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, clean retreat right in the midst of action”
Reviews.Author: Synicgirl
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at Suites 33 for three nights on my first visit to Madrid. The hotel was tucked away on Leganitos right in hte middle to 2 major Metro, and literally a stone'sthrow away from the main shopping street. The hotel was poorly sign posted so look out for the number on the doorway ifyou arriving by cab. The interior of the rooms were a very pleasant surprise. Spacious, airy and modern, the clean lines complements and contrasts wonderfully with the rest of the classical, historical feel of the city. One draw back: if you need wifi access on your trip, you will need to let the reception know to give you a room on the 2nd floor & up. The wifi reception on the 1st floor was sparodic at best. The service staff were all polite and friendly and very willing to accomodate small requests. A wonderful introduction to the city.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, clean hotel in a great location to visit Madrid's main attractions”
Reviews.Author: EvaninCanada
Reviews.Content: I slept at several hotels in Madrid on my three trips there and this was my favourite. It has modern, clean, large rooms; helpful front desk staff; flat screen TV; a safe for valuables. Get room 11 or 21 if you can. They are non-smoking rooms on the side of the hotel away from the street, so very quiet. Street noise interrupted my sleep at every Madrid hotel, except this one - when I was in room 21 (and that was the night Spain won the World Cup and I didn't hear a thing when I went to bed).

Reviews.Title: “what a great place!”
Reviews.Author: DjsTrip
Reviews.Content: Missed my flight out of Madrid, so I had to get a last second reservation here. What a great place! I wish I stayed here earlier during my stay in Madrid. Great location. They have a little kitchenette, which could have been very handy. For around $75, I thought the place was a steal.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and value, Great staff”
Reviews.Author: znn94x
Reviews.Content: Suites 33 was the best facility we stayed at during our recent trip to Europe. Very convenient location to the Metro and within walking distance to most of the sites in Madrid, the hotel is off a side street from the Gran Via near the Plaza de Espana. The rooms are spacious, ours included a refrigerator, microwave, and even a cooktop that we didn't use. Very quiet with no street noise, the climate control system was modern and a welcome change from our experience throughout the other parts of our trip. The staff were excellent, answering our questions and especially in arranging a last-minute Flamenco dinner & show that was the highlight of our stay in Madrid. One note - although the main bed was a king size with the typical very-firm mattress, the pull-out couch was below average. The mattress was thin with weak springs that sagged and squeaked loudly whenever my daughter moved - at 200 pounds there was no way I could have slept on it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with a nice location”
Reviews.Author: styleboy
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel in the center of Madrid ,close to the metro station ,10 min walk from the plaza Mayor.The place is safe to walk also late in the night. The hotel is located on the road but if you ask for a non smoking room on the 3rd floor at the back side, you will not have any problem with the noise

Reviews.Title: “Nice hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: Dutch_dl
Reviews.Content: Very close to the royal palace, we really enjoyed this hotel. It is a little difficult to find as others on here have mentioned, but as long as you take a map you chould be able to find it ok.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel at a value price”
Reviews.Author: Benseibel
Reviews.Content: Got a deal on this hotel through Travelocity. Very nice hotel for its class. Good location, easy walking distance to 2 metro stations, only 10 minutes walk from Plaza Mayor. The neighborhood seemed as safe as anywhere in Madrid; even the Plaza de Espana seemed fine as late as midnight. I worried about noise from the road (Leganitos), so I got a third floor room in the back; only smoking rooms are available there. The room was very quiet at night, and fortunately did not smell of smoke at all. The kitchenette was nice, and added space to the room setup; I brought along a bowl and utensils for breakfast. The bathroom was fine, very clean. The staff could converse in English and were helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is OK. More like a 3 star than a 4 star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: kevinfromaustin
Reviews.Content: The location is superb. Metro is only a block a way. Plaza Mayor and Puerta del Sol are about 10-15 minutes away by walking. Staff are OK, and they lack smile. Their hotel sign is very small that you can easily miss. You are only 150 fee away from the police station, so you can feel safe here. There are some Asian grocery stores that you can buy some basic stuff and drinks until 10 pm, even on weekened and holidays. There is a small kitchen but there are no utensils at all ( not even a fork). The soap and shampoo they offer are more like Motel 6 quality. We paid $290 per night ( after advance booking discount) thru Hotels.com. I believe we could have got a better quality hotel with this price. There are many 4 stars hotels nearby, and their lobbies all look nicer than Suites 33. Of course, you have to be aware that 4 stars hotels are more like 3 stars hotels in the US. Suites 33 is more like a 2 stars hotel in the US. There is a good seafood tapas bar on Leganito which we enjoyed a lot on the New Year eve. But the same time we encountered the rude Madrileños. When I asked a lady to see if I could get a high chair from them since they were 3 persons with 4 chairs. They said "no" as they were using their 4th chair to put their purses. After standing there for 30 minutes, they finally left and their chairs are immediately occupied by another group of 3. I got another denial after asking the new group courteously whether I could get a chair from them. I saw them using the 4th chair to put their coats. What a cultural difference!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and friendly staff-Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Griegos
Reviews.Content: It was our first time in Madrid and the Suites 33 was a excellent hotel , friendly staff, beatiful - comfortable rooms with many space ( bigger than that you see in the pictures) and really clean hotel.We suggest it to everyone, it is generally in a good location and provides you with information material.We hadn't tasted the breakfast .The only that is needed is a music channel.

Reviews.Title: “A terrific find ! We will stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: Maine2664
Reviews.Content: Imagine your first time in Madrid, you take the Metro from the Airport to Plaza de Espana, walk half a block and you are at your hotel. It is 8:30 AM you have flown all night, check in us at 2pm. What do you do? " Hi is our room ready? " You're are greeted warmly and the surprising answer is yes. You are able to check in early, clean up and have a great start to your holiday. The room was clean, the staff cheerful and helpful and the location was spot on for us. We were in the front, on the second floor with a large window that opened to the street. Yes, there was construction, but we were there to play, not sleep when the workers were doing their thing. That was not a bother at all. This hotel is a great value although they should consider adding some glasses, dishes, flatware etc to the well appointed kitchen area. Why have it if you can't use it? I know we do not carry that stuff around with us when we travel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely rooms and helpful staff.. will stay again.”
Reviews.Author: SamInSpain
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay at the Suites 33 in Madrid and can honestly say I will use this hotel again on my return. Great sized rooms and bathrooms, very clean, comfortable, modern. Unsure why there is a kitchenette with no crockery, cuttlery or kettle and would say that this is my only complaint about the place, no tea/coffee making facilities... have to walk to the starbucks on the end of the road for your morning fix! We stayed on the 4th floor overlooking the street. The street the hotel is on is currently being dug up and re-laid, but the hotel has great double glazing and you could not hear a thing. The noise of the busy city was also not heard, ensuring a great nights sleep. Other comments suggest that the hotel is based on a seedy side street, yes there is a strip club a few doors away, but then so is the local cop shop!! This was a weekend trip away for 2 girls, so safety is always a priority for us, we never felt unsafe at any time of the day or night. The reception is 24 hours and all staff throughout the day was extremley helpfull, never failing to answer a question we had. Even calling us in our room with information that they had located for us. The location was great, just a few steps from the Plaza de Espana with great access to the metro and more importantly running parrallel with the Gran Via. So various bars, resturants, theatres and shops are all within a short walking distance. The metro being so easy and cheap to use, just 1 euro per trip for anywhere in the city and 2 euros for the airport. We paid approx. 30 euros from the airport to the hotel on a busy Friday night, however on the return we paid just the 2 euros each and within half an hour we was at the airport. Next time I'm in Madrid, I will use the cheap and highly efficient metro, especially with Suites 33 being just a few yards from the metro stop.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JTraveler0000
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this hotel. While it is close to Plaza de Espana and you are within walking distance to the main parts of the city, it is situated in a seedy looking alley with a strip club nearby. The only non-smoking rooms are the first and second floors, so our room was right on the street. The beds were extremely uncomfortable, very hard. The bathroom had a huge water heater in it, and the walls were covered in some sort of residue. And while none of our showers in Spain had full doors, the one in this hotel was just an open tub without any sort of shower door or curtain, so the bathroom is covered in water after you shower. The rooms were big, but the whole place just felt dingy and depressing. I would definitely stay at the Husa Paseo del Arte next time instead of this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very helpful staff!”
Reviews.Author: helen_lou88
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights and couldn't fault the location, about a 1minute walk away from a metro station which gave you access to the whole of madrid (worth buying a 10trip ticket by the way, much better value for money). The hotel is tucked away so keep your eyes peeled for it, the hotel staff were brilliant, especially Manuel who did everything he could to help you. We were shown to our room and were very impressed, very very clean and comfortable. My only problem would be with the kitchenette! no kettle, mugs, cutlery to make a cup of tea/coffee which was a pain but to be honest, that was the only issue! there was a starbucks at the end of the road so we had to go there instead! Clean towels were brought everyday (as long as you left the used ones on the bath) and the beds were made everyday. as i say, the only issue for me was no tea/coffee making facilities but it isnt something thatd spoil the trip is it? would definitely recommend this hotel, not just for decor and hospitality but also for the location.

Reviews.Title: “discomfort and dishonesty at a price”
Reviews.Author: shanoa
Reviews.Content: The "king" bed was really two twin beds joined together. It was supremely uncomfortable and instead of pillows had only two long bolster like objects and two decorative cushions. The reading lamps were weak and too low making it impossible to read in bed. The bathroom walls were covered in what appeared to be residue from cement or tile grout and when I asked for them to be cleaned I was told that they could not be cleaned as it came from within the walls? Perhaps I misunderstood. The "kitchen" consisted of a small refrigerator that I had to move in order to plug in, a microwave and ceramic counter-top burners that were merely decorative as they did not function. When I asked why I was told that the electricity panel could not support it and that they were to be removed shortly. My guess is that they were merely put there in order to get a certain rating for the hotel and once that was achieved they are now merely decorative. The room was not a suite but a room with very uncomfortable twin beds joined together. There was not a single plate, cup, spoon.....not even a coffee-maker in the room! Internet access was free but incredibly slow, to the point of being non-functional. Two guests were given one key. To call this a suite was dishonest. To call this a hotel was dishonest. to say that it included a "kitchen" was dishonest. To say that two twin beds joined together was a "king" or even a "queen" was dishonest. Altogether, this hotel was uncomfortable to the max and was not at all a 4 star hotel as it purports to be. It is also on a street that is noisy at night.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: patzeric
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for three nights. Overall it was a great hotel. The location is very convienent; you are about a two minute walk away from a metro stop, there are convienence stores nearby, and you are very close to Gran Via, a major street with shopping restaurants, etc. The room was large and well, of spartanly, furnished. There is free wifi, which is nice, and a small cooking area. There were not dishes or utensels in the room, although they may have been available at the front desk; I never bothered to ask. Best of all, there is a Museo de Jamon just around the corner on Gran Via! The room was never noisy, although is should be noted that our window faced an interior atrium, not the street. Others have said that the neighborhood was a little seedy, but we really didn't find it so. We never felt unsafe, day or night. Overall h this was a great hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Jos27
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this very smart hotel for 4 nights in June. Reception staff were very helpful and all spoke excellent english. Hotel location is great - running next to the Gran Via. Street is a little seedy - but police station two doors down helps. Didnt feel unsafe at any stage. Rooms are large and very modern. Great base for a stay in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible value”
Reviews.Author: cpfoutz
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel via online venues and found incredible prices much lower than the average annual price, despite our trip being in July (this was a common theme, likely due to the recession). Upsides: Front desk was great. We needed to modify a reservation with another hotel, however the other hotel didn't have a receptionist who spoke English. The hotels 33 receptionist made the call for us, even negotiated a lower rate with them. The room was very modern with a large marble bathroom. It was also very clean and the bed was among the most comfortable we've had in Europe. The rooms are suites and are outfitted with a small refrigerator, a stove top and a kitchen sink. The interesting thing is, there are no plates, silverwear or cooking utensils. We stayed in two different rooms - one overlooked the street and had a tiny balcony, the other was internal with a view of nothing, but great for those who don't like noise. The location was GREAT. Coming from the airport with big suitcases, we took the metro. If you stop at Plaza de Espana and take the legunitas exit, you'll exit the subway onto the street the hotel is on with few steps to schlep your stuff up. The hotel is about 200 feet down the street. If you need an elevator out of the metro, you can exit in a different place and not have to carry your bags up any steps (though the hotel may be a bit harder to find). you'll only need to carry your bags up two steps at the hotel (though there is a pull down elevator for those two stairs if you are handicapped). The hotel is one block off Gran Via - a 15 minute walk to the palace or the plaza del sol and a 30-45 minute walk from the Prado. Also internet is free and in room accessible if you have your laptop/wireless enabled smartphone. Downsides: Note that none of these things bothered us in the least...but may bother some. When I say modern ambiance, marble bathroom and comfortable bed, I wouldn't consider this a business travel caliber hotel...it's a bit dingy. Lobby was small and, while we had no problem finding the hotel, I can see where this may be a problem. Make sure you have the address on you. There are some seedy bars/strip clubs within a block of the place, but there is also a police station on the same block. I never felt unsafe. room layout was a little wierd in the room that overlooked the street. Overall, we found this to be the best value on our trip, and one of the best we've ever found in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value at very Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: TravellerSomewhere
Reviews.Content: Just spent 3 nights in Suites 33 on a girl's trip to Madrid. The hotel is centally located, reasonably priced and generally a very good deal. If you go to the Plaza de Espana exit section of the metro station and select the Leganitos exit, the hotel is less than 2 minutes form the station. True, there is no hotel sign out front, but the fact that it is in number 33 and this is clearly marked over the door makes it easy to find. The road looks rough, and there's a few seedy bars, but no hassle at all - we never felt the least uncomfortable (2 women in their 30s) The staff was very helpful and the room, depite the very odd kitchen (which even the guy at the front desk could not explain), was good sized, had a bathroom with a bath and very comfortable beds. Our room faced the street, but the noise was not a problem. It was spotless and the staff were friendly, 'Hola's from the cleaners whe you pass a room being made up. The location was great - we like walking, and we walked to major attractions (didn't get on the metro once other than to and from the airport): the Prado (45 mins), The Thyssen Museum (45 mins), the Royal Palace (5 mins), Plaza Major and the old town (10 mins.) etc. There are loads of cafes, bars and restaurants within walking distance, including both Michelin starred establishments and hole-ín-the-wall places. There is not internet access in the hotel, but a the sister hotel up the street (the Hotel El Coloso) offers free internet for Suites 33 guests for flight check in, e-mail pick up etc. and they were very efficient too. This is not a 5 star hotel and it has no amenities, but the location, the comfort and the excellent value (€ 280 for 3 nights booked through the hotel website) makes for a great choice. If you come to Madrid for the city and have a comfy place to put your feet up, this is the place to go.

Reviews.Title: “Clean room with kitchenette, good location, free wifi”
Reviews.Author: amorrow7
Reviews.Content: Location: good location in central Madrid, very close to a Metro station. The Gran Via area is commercial (there is a TGI Fridays and a KFC nearby), but it's within walking distance to less touristy restaurants near Puerta Del Sol or the Chueca area, etc. Note: Calle Leganitos is just off Gran Via, but Leganitos sidewalks were narrower and dirtier. Room: Our non-smoking room was clean and modern. All tile floors (even in hallways), so no dirty carpet to worry about, but can be a bit noisy if someone’s clomping down the hall or dragging a chair across the floor in the room upstairs. Nice sized bathroom for a European hotel. We had plenty of hot water. The plumbing was a little noisy. When someone in a nearby room flushed their toilet, the pipes would make a sound (like microwave popcorn, or someone popping bubble wrap) and then make rushing water noise. But, it wasn’t that big a deal. The air conditioning worked fine, and our window opened onto an airshaft that wasn't too noisy. The kitchenette was really nice. We bought drinks and breakfast items (yogurt and fruit) and kept them in the fridge. Also, free wifi!

Reviews.Title: “I'd book again - great central location & price, rooms remodelled”
Reviews.Author: Queen1000
Reviews.Content: We paid 92 euros per night for 4 nights, including tax (about $120 USD). We booked through their website, where they had deals, and you could change nights/cancel up to 1-2 days prior (you CAN'T do this if you book through the search engine consolidators. We use them for preliminary searches only, then always book directly with the property. If you've ever had to cancel (hotel, air), you'll know why). The lobby is very unimpressive, the rooms are much better. We had room #16 and liked it. Small but newly refurbished & clean, with a little balcony looking onto the street. Marble on all the floors, I think. Yes on Saturday night it was noisy, but the other nights weren't, and we both sleep through noise with ease. Instead of the kitchenette, I wish they had more closet space. Also wish they'd put in a glass ledge in the bathroom to hold toiletries. It'd be cheap to do, Suites 33. There's almost no place to put your bathroom stuff. Manuel at the reservation desk is very helpful. He was there for swing shift, late afternoon to midnight. Mostly Spaniards stay at this hotel, an excellent sign I think. Just want to add one thing I didn't see in the other reviews. Being an American, I was not used to the limited hot water. If you have to wash your hair one day, and there are 2 of you, make sure your partner takes an extra quick shower. Mine took a normal one (about 10 mins), and I was stuck with a wet head for about an hour (takes that long for the individual tank in your room to heat up). Brrrr. Water pressure was great though. We tried another hotel recommended on Trip Advisor, Hotel Plaza Mayor, for a later leg of the trip. That one was more expensive and less modern inside, took awhile for hot water, less water pressure. So I would vote for Suites 33 between the two. Also, if you come by the Metro to Suites 33, there are lots of escalators for your baggage, so you don't have to drag it upstairs much. NOT SO with Hotel Plaza Mayor. My bull moose of a husband had to carry our heavy luggage all the way up LONG staircases - there was NOT ONE escalator in the Sol metro, nor in another nearby metro we tried (can't remember the name). Not everyone has a strong bull moose of a husband like I do, so beware. But you won't have this problem if you stay at Suites 33. PS This hotel is also only a 5 minute walk from fabulous flamenco, Cafe de Chinitas (see my review for tips). Another tip if you're a couple, ask for a "matrimonio" bed. (tiene una cama matrimonio?) That way you won't end up with 2 beds pushed together & made up separately, which we had at first till we requested they make them up as one bed. Would stay at Suites 33 again if we return to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel in central location”
Reviews.Author: T-SGlobetrotters
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights in September. Very conveniently located for Grand Via and Plaza De Espania. Good tip is to catch the metrotrain from the airport cost 2 euros. Take line 8 to Neuvos Ministerios then change to line 10 and travel 4 stops to Plaza de Espania. Hotel is 200 yds from metro station. Rooms are very spacious and include a huge kitchenette area. There is microwave and hob plus good sized fridge which was useful but no utensils/pans etc so you won't be cooking anything. Originally offered a room with a really small bathroom but hotel reception readily offered an alternative with larger bathroom. Furnishing are modern with usual flat screen TV. We were located facing inwards rather than onto the main street and found this very quiet, no problems at all with noise. The receptionists are all very helpful and speak good English The immediate areas is a little shabby but we didn't feel threatened in the slightest. Police station 100m down the road. Great convenience store across the road. Metro is very good for getting around and if there for a few days, there are offers on tickets that make it very cheap. Other lines/stops also convenient for the hotel. There are a lot of prostitutes in areas nearby (although not directly on the street outside the hotel) but they don't cause any problems if you ignore them. Overall a great value hotel which is very well furnished with loads of space at modest price. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem!”
Reviews.Author: LuckyIrish33
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel after reading reviews on trip advisor. As promised the rooms were spacious with nice high ceilings. The rooms were also very clean. I think the small kitchenette is probably for business travellors who come to Madrid for work during the week and perhaps don't eat out every night??? It is a great location especially for the palace. Madrid is also very easy to get about on foot so getting to the better areas for Tapas is ok. Only a small problem was that late at night there were girls stood in doorways of underground clubs which looked a bit dodgy. There were also alot of males stood around in Plaza domingo (possible pimps). Even with this both me and my fellow travellor did not feel uneasy as there is a main police station on the street. Another guest in the Hotel did not see this side of the street at night but they mainly turned left out of the hotel and went via grand Via. I would thoroughly recommend this hotel. staff are also very helpful and speak good english.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't Fault it!”
Reviews.Author: SarahCharles
Reviews.Content: Would deffo stay here again - no problem. Great location just round the corner from the Gran Via, the subway, the tourist bus stop for Madrid Vision. Rooms are modern and have a kitchenette. Take your own kettle though cos although there's a sink, fridge, microwave and hob, there's no utencils. Out of the hotel and either way you'll find corner shops selling everything you want and a cash point turn left. No breakfast as the hotel has only a reception but turn left for Starbucks or right for the 4* hotel which does brekkie. Take the Madrid Vision bus which costs 20 euros for 2 days and you'll see everthing. Don't eat in Plaza Mayor cos the food's rubbish and there are so many other lovely restaurants in the side streets. Email me if you want more info. but this really is the deal booked through last minute i paid £380 for 3 nights for 2 people. Cab from the airport is about €30.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: tupacamar
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful 3 night stay at the Suites 33. The rooms were spacious with a kitchen area, a large bathroom and large living space. Contrary to other reviews we did not experience a noise problem. Our room faced the street, but we experienced no noise issues. The hotel was perfectly situated about a two minute walk from the metro station and the Gran Via, but tucked away in a small side street.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and spacious - shame about the noise”
Reviews.Author: JaneBoleyn
Reviews.Content: We were delighted with the cleanliness and spaciousness of this hotel, with really comfortable beds, lovely bathroom, good TV and we managed to connect to the internet! But unfortunately the noise at night was terrible. Shouting, traffic, and I swear the binmen came every single night at 3 am! There is building work going on just along the way and that started very early every morning too. It is a real shame because we all really liked the hotel itself. Still, it is very central with easy access to the metro and so close to the Gran Via - we had a reasonable kind of breakfast at VIPs there. It may be a good idea to ask for a room that doesn't face the street!

Reviews.Title: “Comfy cozy”
Reviews.Author: arissy
Reviews.Content: This was the hotel we stayed at for the last leg of our trip. We took the metro from the airport and got off the Plaza Espana stop. From the metro stop, it's a quick walk...under 3 mins I would say. There's not signs outside the hotel so you have to keep your eyes open and look for it. even on our last day, I would still just walk right past the front door sometimes. The hotel is comfortable and cozy. The rooms are very new with much more amenities than most European hotels in that class. The beds were big and comfortable. Nice, clean and newer comforters. The bathroom was a good size and the shower worked perfectly. There's a kitchen area, equipped with a fridge and microwave. We couldn't quite get connected to their wifi though. that was major bummer. The hotel was one block from Gran Via, major shopping and good for a quick bite. Within walking distances to Puerta del Sol, plaza mayor. Everythign else is a quick ride on the metro w/ many stops very near to the hotel. It gets a bit noisy at night, esp w/a street facing room. There are several bars on the street, so ppl do talk loudly and since madrid has such an active nightlife, it's something you have to put up with. But I mean other than that, I'd def recommend the place. The staff tried their best to help us to the best of their ability. I'd recommend to eat a bit farther away. We were so tired everyday that we grabbed a convenient bite, but def worth it to explore other parts of hte city for good food.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Secret”
Reviews.Author: dubNewYork
Reviews.Content: We were amazed when we opened the door to our room. It was beautiful for the price that we paid. Getting to the hotel by metro was not that bad - just don't do it if you have a lot of luggage. But it was a major moneysaver (when we left we took a cab to the airport - cost us 42.00 Euros). The hotel is right off the main street of Gran Via, where everything is! But if you don't know where you are going you just might pass right by the hotel and not know it. There is no sign on the front of the hotel - so look carefully. The only problem I had during my stay was internet service. The hotel provides wi-fi service, but my laptop could not find the router. I called the front desk and he simply said "Keep trying". Other than that, the hotel was worth every penny!

Reviews.Title: “nice clean hotel,Eyal Tarrytown-New York”
Reviews.Author: eyalfly
Reviews.Content: nice,clean quiet hotel. has a small kitchenette with heater, micro and fridge. not too bad if you need a place to stay for more then one night and would like to make your own breakfast(which they don´t offer yet). about 10-15 min from the Prado. close enough to walk but you can take a taxi or metro. metro is 200 meters away. if you are not looking for room service, this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel. Helpful and friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: L_Q_7
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at Suites 33. The hotel is very clean, new rooms, helpful and friendly staff. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “Suites 33”
Reviews.Author: aibIreland
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel from 9 to 12 June 2007. Hotel very clean and nice Reception staff very helpful, they rang theme park and other venues to book tickets for us Location quite good, situated on a side street off the Gran Via, therefore not too noisy by night The rooms were cleaned and fresh towels received every day

Reviews.Title: “All in all a perfect hotel for a short trip to Madrid.”
Reviews.Author: MLunn
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel as a last minute offer. According to the website it was 80% discount. Do not know if this is true, but fact is: for 62 € per night we had a beautiful room with a small balcony very close to Gran Via. There is no restaurant facilities yet as the hotel has just opened (no breakfast), but everything in our room was brand new, there is a small kitchen in the room as well, but neither refrigerator nor microwave had been installed. There is also a big flat screen tv in the room, unfortunately only spanish tv-channels, but instead there is free wireless internet at the hotel so a labtop can be very useful. All in all a perfect hotel for a short trip to Madrid. By the way, we never saw the free daily newspaper we were promised when booking...

HotelInfo.Name: Suites 33
HotelInfo.Address: Leganitos 33, 28013 Madrid, Spain
